author: Inyoung Hwang
title: M&A, Earnings Spur Second Day of Advances in European Equities
text:
European stocks advanced for a second day amid earnings announcements and deals activity.
Total SA, Bayer AG and PSA Peugeot Citroen rose more than 1.8 percent after reporting earnings that beat analysts’ estimates. LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE advanced 2.7 percent after posting its biggest earnings gain in three years. Barclays Plc gained 1.8 percent as profit rose. Italcementi SpA surged 50 percent as HeidelbergCement AG will buy it. The German company lost 4.2 percent.
The Stoxx Europe 600 Index gained 0.7 percent to 392.54 at 8:18 a.m. in London. It climbed for the first time in six days on Tuesday amid takeover activity and as some corporate earnings topped projections. Dealmaking is on track for the busiest third quarter on record, with volume set to surpass $1 trillion.
Man Group Plc climbed 4.3 percent after the world’s largest publicly traded hedge fund firm said assets under management rose . Sky Plc added 2.2 percent after reporting an gain in annual sales, boosted by subscriptions to its Web-based Now TV service in the U.K. and new customers in Germany. Royal KPN NV advanced 2.2 percent after the largest Dutch phone company reported quarterly earnings that topped analysts’ estimates. Numericable-SFR SAS jumped 6.5 percent as its profit margin climbed.
Schneider Electric SE dropped 2 percent after the maker of voltage equipment cut its 2015 forecasts for profitability and revenue. LafargeHolcim Ltd. fell 2.5 percent after as analysts said second-quarter earnings at Lafarge and Holcim were below consensus.
The Stoxx 600 is heading for a 3 percent gain in July, after rebounding from a five-month low as concern that Greece may leave the euro faded. It’s advanced 15 percent this year.
Investors will also be watching for comments from the Federal Reserve, which releases its policy statement after the close of European markets on Wednesday.
